A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I was so looking forward to seeing this movie\, as The Force Awakens did such a wonderful job bringing the Star Wars story back to the big screen. BUT\, this movie was a total disappointment. The writing was very shallow and lacked direction and unfortunately none of the characters grab your attention. Then\, halfway thru the movie I realized I was being force fed an implanted Hollywood social agenda inder the guise of an artistic commitment to a legendery piece of creative work. Imagine Lord of the Rings diminshing the fellowship characters to dribbiling weaklings by removing their strength of manly character. This movie abandoned the story.
Luke Skywalker was a grouchy old recluse who appeared weak the entire movie\, Leia was ok\, but stern and without emotion and pointless\, and Laura Dern wore a high shcool prom dress while she battled the First Order to her death.
I could go on\, but my experience of this movie was: trying to stay awake watching a 2 1/2 hour video game. Nothing but constant battle scenes falling short of heroics\, no interlaced effective plot between goog and evil\, and very weak characters. So very disappointed. Not looking forward to the next one at all.
Maybe they can bring Hans Solo back from the dead...
